abstract: Google's Chromebook laptops, with a browser but no desktop software or storage, are hard for people to understand, so Google is inviting shoppers to test them out in pop-up shops in the United States and Britain.
snippet: Google's Chromebook laptops, with a browser but no desktop software or storage, are hard for people to understand, so Google is inviting shoppers to test them out in pop-up shops in the United States and Britain.
lead_paragraph: When Google introduced Chromebooks, laptops running its Chrome operating system, it showed a promotional video with the tagline, "Ready when you are."

headline.main: Google Opens Pop-Up Shops for a Hands-On Chromebook Experience
